detailsOfAchievement: Education provided to large number of children. Health Services extended to excluded communities. Vocational education provided to tribal and dalit young people and women with high level of employment created.

In this year, we have reached out to additional 1400 dalit chidlren through 89 government schools. Added to it, we have built done capacity building for the school management committee for the purpose of monitoring and governing the school from the right to education perspectives. The Tribal Health Project with focus on TB was implemented in East and West Singbhum Districts of Jharkhand State. The objective was to reduce and prevent TB. In pursuance of the objective, we have deployed a van with electronic microscope, which visited target villages. The villagers were mobilised by the village panchayat and Self-help groups for women. The van with a doctor and diagnostician visited to villages, took sputum samples, tested it instantly and if found positive, they were link

The project was implemented in Kannaginagar, Chennai. The target for the project was young people in urban slum. The objective of the project is to empower urban youth for realisation of their rights and entitlements. The project mobilised young people in the age group 15 to 26 years into groups. They were further trained and enabled to claim their right to urban facilities and services from the city and local governments. The project implementation resulted in capacitation and increased access

The project was implemented in Kannaginagar, Chennai. The target for the project was young people in urban slum. The objective of the project is to empower urban youth for realisation of their rights and entitlements. The project mobilised young people in the age group 15 to 26 years into groups. They were further trained and enabled to claim their right to urban facilities and services from the city and local governments. The project implementation resulted in capacitation and increased acces.

This is a computer literacy project implemented in two Higher Secondary Schools –Maduramangalam and Kannaginagar in Kancheepuram Districts of Tamilnadu. The objective of the project is to increase the computer literacy and functional skills of government school going poor children studying in 5th to 12th standard. The project set up a computer centre with 20 computers and two trainers. The project trained about 4025 boys and girls hailing from the low income group.

In continuation of last year, in this year, additional 32 villages were targeted and reached out to the families, who were vulnerable to TB. The project resulted in identification of persons with symptoms of TB. They were further tested for TB and cases of confirmed TB status were enrolled for treatment through the local government facilities. The project followed up with them through the government TB and health service providers and the local forums till they completely cured.

This is the follow on project implemented by targeting dalit children-boys and girls in Palamau District of Jharkhand State. In this year, the project engaged school teachers, school management committees, parents and local panchayats to make sure all dait children get full access and quality primary education as a matter of right. As a result of the project, the school facilities and services got boost up, which added greater values in terms of improved standard of education .

The project training for differentially abled youth was implemented in Chennai in partnership with Vocational Rehabilitation Centre of Government. The purpose of the project is to skill differential youth for employment. The project mostly targeted physically challenged young people by training 123 youth in the trades of cell phone repair, BPO and computer applications. As a result of the project, 102 young physically challenged youth got placement and 12 set up their on shops/service centre.

In this year, we have measured the impacts and values generated by the project. It was found that the project made greater changes in the school, community and family system in line with the right to education tenets. Further, the project resulted in transforming the attitude and practices of parents and teachers as a result of the better understanding of the need and value of education for children.

This project is intended to provide coaching and supplementary education for the poor children in our neighbourhood. The purpose of the project is to improve the academic performance of children haling from the low income groups. Under this, we have deployed teachers to provide value added education services as per the needs and problems of the children. Slow learning children were identified and support was rendered to make them excell in education.

detailsOfAchievement: The YR Gaitonde Medical, Educational and Research Foundation (1985), an internationally recognized non-profit in Chennai pioneers HIV prevention, care and research through the YRG Center for AIDS Research and Education (YRGCARE). The Foundationâ€™s livelihood initiative â€˜ECO Kitchenâ€™ addresses economic stability within families affected by social and economic challenges. Dr Suniti Solomon, Founder, and her team at Madras Medical College, documented first evidence of HIV in India (1986). YRGCAREâ€™s expertise includes HIV clinical care for over 19000 patients living with HIV, outreach prevention services, a NABL accredited laboratory, medical and counseling training and clinical, laboratory and behavioural research. Services: HIV, sexuality, treatment education; anonymous testing for HIV/STI; healthcare and support; matrimonial services; reproductive health; pediatric care and therapeutic recreation camps for children with HIV; and clinics for MSM and IDUs. ECO Kitchenâ€™s Project ECO (Enhancing Community Opportunities) has four components. Kathir: innovative food retail micro-entrepreneurship supporting disadvantaged women and their families; Kathir Dhan: responds to hunger and malnutrition, building bridges between those in need and those who wish to help; Out-of-the-Box: serves personalized meals-corporate pantries and private catering events, employs women as food service agents; Endrum Punnagai: helps children at schools (Corporation of Chennai) to enhance health, self-confidence and interpersonal communication.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Build a rural community outreach model to address the complex needs of rural HIV prevention, care and support requirements in Ludhiana, a high prevalence / highly vulnerable district. The Link Worker Scheme (LWS) is a medium term, meso-level strategy, whose scope is limited to five years. The services established through the link worker scheme will be linked to local health governance system at three levels. This will again ensure mainstreaming of the HIV response project

detailsOfAchievement: Bharathi Women Development Centre is a Voluntary, Community based service and Developmental Agency. It was formed by a committed and dedicated group of women mostly based on Rural areas of Thiruvarur District of Tamil Nadu in South India. It was started in 1985 and legally registered in 1987. Most of the members of the organization are women social workers, women actives and eminent persons in our area. The prime aim of the organization is women empowerment and also having objectives of rural development, child care, aged care, rehabilitation of handicaps and all round development of the rural community. Since 1985 it has been executing various developmental and welfare programmes for the benefit of its own target community / people. Since its inception it has been closely collaborating with the State Government, Central Government and other Foreign Funding Agencies. As our organization is two decade old organization we have got rich experience in implementing women development as well as rural development programmes like Mahalir Thittam ( SHGs ), Short Stay Home, Old Age Home, Family Counseling Centre, 15 Bedded De - Addiction Treatment Cum Rehabilitation Centre, Health Programmes including AIDS / HIV Environmental programmes, Creches, Women Employment Training Programmes, Income Generation programme for women, and other Rural Development Programmes.
